metadata.title: Implement Multi-Tenant SaaS Marketing Landing Page Redesign
metadata.prd_reference: 5 Frontend Design Guidelines + user-specified Healio visual direction for trust, bento layouts, and frictionless workflows

context.background: This task replaces the current developer primitive showcase homepage with a polished marketing landing page tailored to Healio’s multi-tenant clinic SaaS use case. The page should be conversion-oriented, visually distinctive, and aligned with the research and content spec produced in the preceding tasks.

design_constraints.constraint: Design must feel trustworthy and operationally serious (healthcare billing/records context), not a generic startup template.
Use an intentional visual system consistent with Healio’s palette and bento-card direction: soft off-white background, white cards, calm accents, strong hierarchy.
Communicate multi-tenant and multi-role value clearly (clinic owner, doctor, receptionist workflows) and show how booking/patients/billing/analytics connect.
Use accessible semantic markup and keyboard-friendly CTA/navigation interactions.
Avoid reusing the current primitive showcase content as the primary page experience.

instruction.step: Replace the current homepage implementation in `healio/app/page.tsx` with a marketing landing page built from reusable sections/components (prefer `components/marketing/*` where it improves maintainability).

Implement the section sequence and copy from the landing-page content spec, including hero, trust/proof band, feature/workflow sections, multi-tenant/RBAC/security messaging, integration or operations highlights, and final CTA/footer blocks.
Make the page visually polished (typography hierarchy, spacing rhythm, background treatment, card composition, clear CTA emphasis) and tailored to clinic operations buyers.
Ensure the page has mobile-ready layout behavior and preserves accessibility basics (landmarks, heading order, interactive labels, focus visibility).
Keep implementation bounded to the landing page and supporting marketing components/styles only.

validation_checklist.check: Run `npm run typecheck` after the landing page implementation changes.
Verify the page renders correctly on desktop and mobile widths.
Use Chrome DevTools MCP to inspect structure, interactions, console output, and capture validation snapshots before marking done.
Confirm the homepage now communicates Healio as a clinic SaaS (not a UI primitive showcase/demo page).

acceptance_criteria.criterion: The homepage is redesigned into a polished marketing landing page and no longer presents the primitive showcase as the primary experience.
The page communicates Healio’s multi-tenant / multi-role clinic SaaS value proposition with clear CTAs and coherent section hierarchy.
Styling aligns with the user-requested Healio visual direction (trust-oriented, bento-friendly, legible, calm accents).
Desktop/mobile rendering and basic accessibility interactions are verified via Chrome DevTools MCP and recorded in evidence.

output_spec.commit_message: feat(healio-marketing): redesign landing page for multi-tenant clinic SaaS

evidence.item: When work starts/completes, record changed files, typecheck command, Chrome DevTools MCP snapshots/interaction notes, and commit references here.
Include Chrome DevTools MCP evidence (desktop + mobile snapshots, console check, and primary CTA/navigation interaction check) before marking complete.

execution_tracking.completion_signal: Task is done only when state=DONE, is_done=true, completed_at is filled, verification_status=PASSED, and evidence records changed files/tests/snapshots as applicable.

references.verification_tool: Chrome DevTools MCP (required for frontend task verification)
